content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem for Fastest and Code Golf, clearly specified and "stylistically" matching. The solution is trivial but that's okay for those modes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I agree with this contribution because it's a fun way to expose a problem, parsing multiple Array. 

It's perfect for clash of code (speed and code golf), but not in reverse mode.

Hi! Very nice problem! Aside from all other comments, your contribution expects an output containing "DNA" and "RNA", whereas the default result string in the IDE mentions "ADN" and "ARN", maybe it would be best for these to be the same!

Goal:
- As signalled in other comments, "If you know biochemistry" -> "In biochemistry".
- "[[Protein]]s are made up" -> "[[Protein]] is made up of" (for consistency with others)

Output:
- "{{sequence}} [[is DNA or RNA or Protein]] | [[artificial]]" -> "{{sequence}} [[is DNA or RNA or Protein]] or {{sequence}} [[is artificial]]" (I thought for artificial, you just had to put "artificial", which thankfully was validated).

Stub generator:
- "write sequence is ADN or ARN or Protein | artificial" -> "write sequence is ADN or ARN or Protein | sequence is artificial" (for consistency with output)

Tests:
- "Don't laught" -> "Don't laugh"

I'll approve once these issues are adressed :)

I like the idea of this contribution.
However I think you should not start the goal like this: "If you know biochemistry," because most of us do not know biochemistry...
It implies we need certain domain knowledge to solve this puzzle so some of us will choose another challenge instead of reading further...
Simply start like this: "In biochemistry" or make up a fun story to introduce the problem.

Title
* Please fix the typo: "identifyer" => "identifier".

* There seems to be an extra apostrophe which can be deleted and changed to a space character instead.

Goal
* Please add "." at the end of each sentence for clarity.

* The meaning of the last sentence is unclear. Suggest to rewrite it as:
A [[sequence]] which is none of the above molecules is {{artificial}}.

Input
* Please change "{{Sequence}}" to "[[sequence]]" (format as variable and in lowercase for consistency).

Output
* Please change "Sequence" to "sequence" for consistency.

Constraints
* Please change "Sequence" to "sequence" for consistency.

Cases
* Please swap the cases so that each pair of test and validator is similar.

For example, there are 4 validators where the sequence is artificial, but no tests covering the same situation.

Game modes
* I think it is too difficult to deduce all the rules in Reverse mode.

Thanks.
Thank you very much for your careful proofreading. I will try to correct it.
